intro: Barkhausia bursifolia, commonly known as the burr-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its unique leaf structure helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Barkhausia bursifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and drought tolerance.
